news_header: Sir Evelyn de Rothschild left his bank after a sexual misconduct investigation in 2003.
news_original_title: Evelyn de Rothschild left bank after misconduct claim
news_text: Sir Evelyn de Rothschild, a prominent British financier and adviser to Queen Elizabeth, departed from the bank named after his family following a sexual misconduct investigation in 2003. An internal memo revealed that while a single complaint was found, it was investigated and led to his exit in March 2004. The memo stated that no other complaints were recorded against him, despite allegations from multiple sources regarding his behavior in the 1990s. The bank emphasized its zero-tolerance policy towards such conduct.
